facts.fact_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026, the lowest reading since December 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026, the lowest reading since December 2022.

facts.fact_text: The sub-index for the current economic situation of the country declined 0.5 points to 38.8.

evidences.evidence_text: The sub-index for the current economic situation of the country declined 0.5 points to 38.8

facts.fact_text: Expectations for the economy in 12 months also dropped 0.5 points to 43.9.

evidences.evidence_text: expectations for the economy in 12 months also dropped 0.5 points to 43.9.

facts.fact_text: Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.

evidences.evidence_text: Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.

facts.fact_text: The assessment of the current household economic situation fell 0.9 points but remained above the optimism threshold at 50.3.

evidences.evidence_text: the assessment of the current household economic situation fell 0.9 points but remained above the optimism threshold at 50.3

facts.fact_text: Expectations for household finances in 12 months eased 0.7 points to 56.6.

evidences.evidence_text: expectations for household finances in 12 months eased 0.7 points to 56.6.

facts.fact_text: On an annual basis, consumer confidence was down 2.7 points.

evidences.evidence_text: On an annual basis, consumer confidence was down 2.7 points.

evidence.evidence_text: Mexico’s Consumer Confidence Index fell 0.6 points month-on-month to 44.0 in January 2026, the lowest reading since December 2022.
The sub-index for the current economic situation of the country declined 0.5 points to 38.8
expectations for the economy in 12 months also dropped 0.5 points to 43.9.
Households’ current ability to purchase durable goods slipped 0.4 points to 30.5.
the assessment of the current household economic situation fell 0.9 points but remained above the optimism threshold at 50.3
expectations for household finances in 12 months eased 0.7 points to 56.6.
